description.narrative: By 2016, child participation spaces are strengthened and children from organized groups are empowered to speak for themselves (1. 1: C2C & Y2Y Media), which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Human Rights Institutions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, children, young people, civil society and private sector representatives and duty bearers participate in the formulation and monitoring of a transparent and equitable national development agenda

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, child participation spaces are strengthened and children from organized groups are empowered to speak for themselves (1. 1: C2C & Y2Y Media)

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened child and adolescents participation spaces through child-to-child media programmes, child parliament, youth parliament, SMS Biz/U-Report and youth religious groups. To ensure further integration, the UNICEF child participation strategy was finalized and recommendations incorporated in the new country programme. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/01/2017

title.narrative: # of adolescents and young people, disaggregated by age and gender, registered and counselled on SRH and HIV prevention through SMS BIZ

actual.value: 2016:In 2016, more than 63,000 adolescents and young people registered (35,000 males and 25,000 females). Adolescents and young people aged 15-19 and 20-24 are more engaged and counselled on SRH and HIV prevention related issues through SMS BIZ. The top 3 most discussed topics are: Sexuality, Family plan

title.narrative: N. of youth religious leaders trained on key second decade priority issues, in Tete, Zambzia, Gaza, Nampula, Cabo Delgado and Maputo provinces

actual.value: 2016:In 2016, 584 youth leaders of religious groups were trained on prevention of child marriage and HIV, reproductive health, gender related issues, malaria and cholera prevention. Around 53.000 young people were involved in debates on these issues. Young leaders also participated directly in 62 radio p

title.narrative: Number of adolescents 10-19 and youth 20-24 peer counselled on the second decade priority issues (HIV prevention, early pregnancies, child marriage and violence) through the SMS BIZ (U-Report) platform

actual.value: 2016:More than 35,000 adolescents aged 10-19 and around 14,600 young people aged 20-24 were counselled on the second decade priority issues (HIV prevention, early pregnancies, child marriage and violence) through the free counselling service, SMS BIZ (U-Report) platform.

title.narrative: # of radio and television programmes produced and presented by children and youth on child rights issues

actual.value: 2016:TVM: 368 weekly programmes produced at national and provincial level involving all TVM provincial delegations, service providers, school children, Child Parliament and Rapariga BIZ mentors representatives. Two child-to-child “Roda Viva” clubs were launched in Tete and Maputo Provinces and recruitmen
